name: Where Everyone Knows Their Guest Stars Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: I played Harry the Hat. I later got my own series called "Night Court" where I played Judge Harry Stone.
questions.explanation:
Harry Anderson.

	Harry the Hat, first appeared on "Cheers" in episode five "Sam at Eleven." He is a great conartist.

questions.text: I once played a friend of Diane's named Rebecca. I wanted to go out with a man who had no intellect whatsoever, so of course I picked Sam Malone. Before "Cheers" I was on "Newhart" as Stephanie.
questions.explanation:
Julia Duffy.

	Julia Duffy guest stared on episode number 8, entitled "Any Friend of Diane's."

questions.text: I guest stared as Diane's mother, Helen Chambers. When I was much younger I played Mrs. Banks in "Mary Poppins."
questions.explanation:
Glynis Johns.

	Glynis Johns guest stared on episode 20. The show was entitled "Someone Single, Someone Blue." In this episode, Diane's mother, who is rich, will lose the money she got from her father if Diane doesn't marry someone right away.

questions.text: I once played a millionaire who left a lot of money to the patrons and workers of "Cheers." I was also Henry on "Punky Brewster."
questions.explanation:
George Gaynes.

	George Gaynes guest stared on episode 30 entitled "Where There's a Will..."

questions.text: I appeared a few times as Loretta Tortelli, Nick's 2nd wife. In real life my husband is an announcer often seen doing count downs. Coming in as Nick Tortelli's second wife...who am I?
questions.explanation:
Jean Kasem.

	Jean Kasem is married to Casey Kasem.

questions.text: I once guest stared on a two-part episode playing an artist named Phillip Semenko. Sam hated me, but Diane loved me. It was my painting that caused them to break up. I am best known for my part as Doc Brown in the movie trilogy "Back to the Future".
questions.explanation:
Christopher Lloyd.

	Phillip Semenko was a strange man. Diane went behind Sam's back to get the picture painted of her, which is what made Sam mad.

questions.text: I once guest starred as a suicidal woman from Diane's therapy group that fell in love with Sam Malone. You might have also seen me on "Taxi" or in the movie "The Princess Bride."
questions.explanation:
Carol Kane.

	Carol Kane played Amanda on episode number 53 called "A Ditch in Time".

questions.text: I once played a friend of Sam's who he made a bet with. The bet was that Sam had to marry Jaqueline Bisset or I get his bar. My characters' name on that episode was Eddie Gordon. You might have also seen me on another show called "Seinfeld."
questions.explanation:
Michael Richards.

	This was the 63rd episode and it was called "Bar Bet."

questions.text: I guest starred for awhile as Carla's boyfriend, then second husband Eddie LeBec. I later had my own series on CBS.
questions.explanation:
Jay Thomas.

	Eddie's real name on the show was Guy (pronounces Gee where the /g/ sounds like the /g/ in goat. He went by Eddie because according to Carla, Guy sounded to "weenie."

questions.text: I once played a marriage counselor that knew Fraiser Crane. I was driven crazy by Diane becuase I told her and Sam they shouldn't get married ever. Most currently (as of 2003) I can be seen in the "Harry Potter" movies.
questions.explanation:
John Cleese.

	John Cleese played Nearly Headless Nick in the "Harry Potter" movies. On "Cheers" he played Dr. Simon Finch-Royce on episode 117 entitled, "Simon Says."
